intro: Sida cordifolia var. althaeifolia, commonly known as Indian mallow, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other species like cotton and hibiscus. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along waterways. Its fibrous stems and leaves have been used in traditional medicine for their potential anti-inflammatory and wound-healing properties.
